content: instructions roof the roof is knit from the bottom up with your castle color s cast on 20 sts divide the sts onto 3 dpns as follows - needle 1 has 10 sts and needle 2 & 3 have 5 sts each join to work in the round round 1 purl round 2 knit round 3 ssk k6 k2tog twice 16 sts round 4 knit round 5 ssk k4 k2tog twice 12 sts round 6 knit redistribute the stitches to 2 dpns needle 1 and 2 now both have 6 sts each round 7 ssk k2 k2tog twice 8 sts round 8 knit round 9 ssk k2tog twice 4 sts round 10 knit break yarn draw end through the remaining 4 sts pull tight and secure insert end down into the roof and weave in on the underside weave in the cast on end tower the tower is knit from the top down with your castle color s cast on 10 sts leaving a long tail for sewing together in finishing divide the sts onto 2 dpns so that needle 1 and 2 both have 5 sts each and join to knit in the round round 1 purl round 2 -18 knit round 19 k1 m1r k3 m1l k1 twice 14 sts round 20 purl cast off tidy hole while weaving in end and hide inside hole remains open don t weave in cast on end finishing embroidery make 3 french knots for the windows count 4 sts down from the purl bump round round 1 in the middle and place your first window then count 3 sts down for your next 2 windows see photo on page 2 for location be careful not to stitch the 2 sides together i start with my top window and enter from the cast on end secure the bottom end the best you can and hide ends inside the door is made with about 3 satin stitches it is approximately 1 stitch wide and 3 sts tall place one horizontal stitch on top do not stitch the 2 sides together knot the 2 ends together and hide inside seaming to stitch the castle s roof to the tower first line the 2 pieces up next thread your cast on end onto a needle and then use whip stitch to sew them together to keep it straight i sew my purl bump round round 1 of my tower to two purl bumps rounds down from the underside of roof see photo page 2 stuffing to stuff your castle - push your stuffing up through the bottom hole i like to push it in with my thumb pattern help thanks for knitting one of my designs for pattern support just pm me on
